content: eight crafters today on the dams craft I'm going to show you how to make super
easy tables whereas my Hasenpfeffer the table I'm going to make is the round
variety and you can see the pieces I've got here I've got an inch and a half
disc and I bought that at the craft store already pre-cut and everything so
it's ready to go I got a half an inch spool there these were also in the at
the craft section for the little wood different shaped wood pieces and then I
have a 1 inch washer which is nice because it'll give it weight
I thought it'd be fun to give the bottom of the table a little detail so I took
some coffee stirrers and I cut a quarter of an inch off each end and you'll see
how I use those in the next section so I'm going to use my craft goop to put
this all together this got glue gives a great bond I love it it's roast also
going to be good for gluing the wood to the metal piece since the metal washer
is not porous you don't get a nice bond so here you see the table all
constructed and this couldn't be it have been easier I've got the disc on top the
spool in the center is a stand and then I have it glued to the washer for weight
so that's really nice for the weight keeps it from falling over and then I've
got those little pieces that I use from the coffee stirrers to give it a little
extra detail alright so here's my table and looks really nice
it's basically spray-painted black then I washed it with a burnt umber I'm gonna
use that golden brown now just like I did on the chairs and I'm gonna use this
brush this is this brush is ideal for this because it's all kind of
willy-nilly you can get these at almost any hardware store they're really cheap
they're about a dollar each so this these are some great brushes to have for
this type of technique so I don't load my brush with some golden brown not too
much it's almost like a dry brush technique and I what I'm going to do is
kind of go around the edge like this and then a little more and I'll do the top
now y'all you want to drag it all time in the same direction so I kind of like
that alright and that kind of gives a nice impression and like wood grain and
that kind of thing now for the rest just kind of pull out from the bottom there
and then you can just kind of dry brush the rest just kind of go like that pick
out the edges that kind of thing all right that's all there is to it and
bam you have a table ready for your game so it couldn't be easier all right so
here we go here's our finished table on the tile looks great we got the chairs
